ovdesc.p: This table defines to the XT.MATCH.MAP and XT.OUTPUT programs which internal files are accessed, and how.
It links external fields to record ids of the internal files either directly, or via a concat file (secondary index).

desc.p: Identifies the source and the file to be accessed, via a two part key.
Source name 3-20 type AA (alphanumeric), followed by: '.' a single dot, followed by file name in full or abbreviated form e.g. EXBOND.BD.BOND.MASTER
Source - must exist on XT.SOURCES table.
File name may be entered as an abbreviation of the Example type program that maintains it, or as a full file name. Only files of types H U L or T are valid.
This is a multi valued field. Standard T24 alphanumeric field.
A maximum of 35 characters may be entered.
This is the field number of the main file that is used as a secondary index.

If the main file is not accessed directly, but via a concat file (e.g. bond master via Exbond code), and the main file is maintained by an Example type program, then the user can indicate which field number to use as the secondary index.
Numeric. (Optional input, if main file is maintained by an Example type program, else this field is NOINPUT).
The field number must be a concat field as defined by the Example maintenance program.
This is the file name of the secondary index that is used to access the main file

If the main file is not accessed directly, but via a concat file (e.g. bond master via Exbond code), and the main file is not maintained by an Example type program (i.e there is no way of linking a field number with a secondary index), then the user has to enter the name of the secondary index.
7-32 type AA (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input, if main file is not maintained by an Example type program, else this field is NOINPUT).
The name must be a valid file name
Describes the file named by this record.
3-35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multilanguage field. (Mandatory input)
This is the field name of the external data that is used to access the main file
This field is the key to access the internal files, either via a specified concat file (or field number), or directly as the record key.
20 type AA (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input.)
The name must exist on the XT.RECORD.DEFS records for the source specified in the this record id.
